sponsor: Teva Branded Pharmaceutical Products R&D, Inc.
briefTitle: Study of an Investigational Nasal Aerosol or Placebo Nasal Aerosol in Children (Ages 6-11) With Seasonal Allergies
officialTitle: Study of Two Doses of an Investigational Nasal Aerosol Placebo Nasal Aerosol in Children (Ages 6-11) With Seasonal Allergies
summary: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety and efficacy of an investigational nasal aerosol at two doses compared with placebo nasal aerosol in the treatment of seasonal allergic rhinitis in children (6-11 years of age).

primaryOutcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Average Morning (AM) and Evening (PM) Subject-Reported Reflective Total Nasal Symptom Score (rTNSS) During the Two Weeks of Treatment
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Baseline (Day -4 to Day 1 predose), Days 1 (postdose) to Day 15
